title: 103_hr5098
content: The Act titled "Fort Peck Tribes- Montana Compact Act of 1994" is ratified and confirmed, approving agreements related to the use of water rights for the Fort Peck Indian Tribes in Montana. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes in Montana may enter into Water Agreements for the use of water rights, subject to Secretary approval. The agreements can include delivery, use, transfer, diversion, or use of tribal water rights for up to 50 years. The Secretary must approve or disapprove agreements within specific timeframes. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes in Montana can enter Water Agreements for up to 50 years, subject to Secretary approval. The Tribes' information related to agreements is treated as privileged. They are restricted from authorizing tribal water rights use outside the Basin. The Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States. The Secretary of the Treasury deposits 10 percent of receipts from integrated programs of the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin Project into the fund, not exceeding $50,000,000. Interest accrued on deposits is placed in a separate account for tribal economic development purposes. The Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States for long-term profit opportunities and employment for tribal members. Amounts deposited are nonreimbursable and nonreturnable, with no reduction in Federal services for the Tribes. Payments are not subject to income tax and not distributed on a per capita basis. Claims against the United States are waived in consideration of required actions. In exchange for the United States fulfilling all obligations under the Act, including funding the Tribes' Economic Recovery Fund, the Tribes will waive any claims related to water rights settled by the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. This section defines key terms related to the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact, including the Reservation, Secretary, Tribes, tribal water right, and Fund.
